page.title: 04Ulverston Canal
page.content: The first sod of the canal was cut in September 1793 by Colonel Sunder- land and it was{opened in 1796.}The canal brought prosperity to the town with a population of 3,000. Trade with the rest of England increased.Between 1798 and 1848,over 13,000 ships used the canal;this was over 1.1 million tonnes of shipping. When it was built, it was the shortest,straightest canal in England being only{1.5 miles long. Its importance declined after 1857 when a railway line was laid. The canal is now owned by Glaxochem plc. who use it as cooling water.Ulv- erston Anglers have fishing rights to the canal and it is used for the annual Charter celebrations. The canal has recently been renovated at a cost of Â£26,000 spent to stop the banks collapsing and on clearing litter in and around the canal.
